bibl.title: Letter from J. F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, December 23, 1947

div1.p: Siler discusses plans to place markers in the room where Walter Reed died, located in the present Army War College. He will send Hench a copy of the Reed Memorial board from last year.

div1.head: Letter from J. F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, December 23, 1947
div1.opener:
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
1835 EYE STREET, NORTHWEST
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
December 23, 1947
EXECUTIVE OFFICES
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p: This will acknowledge teceipt of your note of December 13.

Before taking any further steps concerning the markers to
be placed at the Army War College, we will await receipt of the
photographs referred to in your letter and the memorandum from Gen.
Truby which you expect to receive in the near future.

I saw Gen. Kean a few days ago and talked with him about the
memorial plaques to be placed in the Memorial Building. When I receive
the memo from Gen. Truby, I will take up the matter with him again and
then will get in touch with you before coming to any conclusion as to
the exact wording of the markers.

We will make a copy of the minutes of last year's meeting and
send to you under separate cover. We will not copy the exhibit attached
to the minutes since it was prepared by you and you doubtless have a
copy.

With very best wishes for the holiday season to you and Mrs.
Hench and your very delightful young daughter, in which Mrs. Siler
joins, I am
div1.closer:
Faithfully yours, J. F. Siler
Col. U.S.A., Retired jfs k
